message.content: Read .scaffold_context and app_metadata.json. Analyze data, decide UI paradigm in 1-2 sentences, then implement directly. Follow .claude/skills/frontend-impl/SKILL.md. Use existing types and services from src/types/ and src/services/. Deploy when done using the deploy_to_github tool.

content.text: I'll start by reading the scaffold context and skill file to understand what I'm working with.

content.content:
1→---
     2→name: frontend-impl
     3→description: |
     4→  Activate this skill when:
     5→  - Building DashboardOverview.tsx
     6→  - Writing React/TypeScript code
     7→  - Integrating with Living Apps API
     8→allowed-tools:
     9→  - Read
    10→  - Write
    11→  - Edit
    12→  - Bash
    13→  - Glob
    14→  - Grep
    15→---
    16→
    17→# Frontend Implementation Skill
    18→
    19→Build a **production-ready, domain-specific dashboard** as the app's primary workspace.
    20→
    21→---
    22→
    23→## Step 1: Analyze and Decide (MANDATORY — before any code)
    24→
    25→Read `.scaffold_context` and `app_metadata.json`. Then write 1-2 sentences describing:
    26→
    27→1. **What is the best UI paradigm for the user's core workflow?**
    28→2. **Why is this the most natural way to interact with THIS data?**
    29→
    30→Use this table to guide your choice:
    31→
    32→| Data Nature | Best UI Paradigm |
    33→|-------------|-----------------|
    34→| Time-based / scheduled entries | Calendar, week planner, timeline |
    35→| Status-based / workflow stages | Kanban board, progress pipeline |
    36→| Quantitative / goal-tracking | Progress rings, gauges, trend charts |
    37→| Hierarchical / categorized | Grouped sections, nested views |
    38→| Sequential / step-by-step | Stepper, checklist, flow view |
    39→| Relational / many linked items | Master-detail, linked cards |
    40→
    41→Then implement immediately. No design_brief.md, no task lists, no planning documents.
    42→
    43→---
    44→
    45→## Step 2: Edit index.css (design tokens)
    46→
    47→**Use Edit, NOT Write** — `index.css` is pre-generated with correct import order.
    48→
    49→Choose a font and color palette that fits the app's domain, then add your tokens:
    50→
    51→```css
    52→@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=...');  /* URL imports FIRST */
    53→@import "tailwindcss";
    54→@import "tw-animate-css";
    55→
    56→/* EXTEND :root — do NOT rewrite */
    57→:root {
    58→  --background: oklch(...);
    59→  --foreground: oklch(...);
    60→  --card: oklch(...);
    61→  --primary: oklch(...);
    62→  /* ... */
    63→  --gradient-primary: linear-gradient(135deg, oklch(...), oklch(...));
    64→  --shadow-elegant: 0 10px 30px -10px oklch(... / 0.3);
    65→}
    66→```
    67→
    68→**CSS Import Order MUST stay intact:** `@import url(...)` FIRST, then `@import "tailwindcss"`, then `@import "tw-animate-css"`.
    69→
    70→## Step 3: Edit Layout.tsx (title only)
    71→
    72→Use Edit to change `APP_TITLE` and `APP_SUBTITLE`. Nothing else.
    73→
    74→## Step 4: Write DashboardOverview.tsx
    75→
    76→Plan the ENTIRE component, then Write it ONCE.
    77→
    78→**ONE COMPONENT PER FILE (mandatory).** Every React component gets its own file in `src/components/`. DashboardOverview.tsx is the orchestrator — it imports and composes components, it does NOT contain hundreds of lines of inline logic. Extract interactive views (calendar, kanban, etc.), charts, dialogs, and reusable UI into separate files.
    79→
    80→## Step 5: Deploy
    81→
    82→```bash
    83→npm run build
    84→```
    85→
    86→Then call `mcp__deploy_tools__deploy_to_github`
    87→
    88→---
    89→
    90→## What Is Pre-Generated (DO NOT touch!)
    91→
    92→CRUD sub-pages, dialogs, routing, sidebar, and shared components are pre-generated. Changing CSS variables in `index.css` automatically updates their appearance.
    93→
    94→**DO NOT touch:** CRUD pages, dialogs, App.tsx, PageShell.tsx, StatCard.tsx, ConfirmDialog.tsx.
    95→
    96→---
    97→
    98→## Dashboard = Primary Workspace, NOT Info Page
    99→
   100→**The #1 mistake is building the dashboard as a passive info screen** (KPI cards + chart + recent activity). Users want to WORK with their data, not just look at it.
   101→
   102→### The Core Interactive Component
   103→
   104→Every dashboard needs ONE interactive component — the **reason users open the app**. This component:
   105→
   106→- Takes up significant screen space (hero, not sidebar widget)
   107→- Supports create, edit, delete directly (click empty slot → create dialog, click entry → edit)
   108→- Shows data in its most natural form (the paradigm you chose in Step 1)
   109→- Provides immediate visual feedback
   110→
   111→The pre-generated CRUD list pages are a fallback. Users should do 90% of their work without leaving the dashboard.
   112→
   113→### Anti-Slop Checklist (if ANY true, redesign!)
   114→
   115→- Dashboard is a passive info page — only KPI cards and charts
   116→- No domain-specific UI — uses generic list/table for core data
   117→- All KPI cards look identical
   118→- Layout is a boring 2x2 or 3x3 grid
   119→- No clear hero element
   120→- Colors are generic blue/green/red
   121→- Dashboard could be for ANY app
   122→- Font is Inter, Roboto, Open Sans, Lato, Arial, Helvetica, or system-ui
   123→
   124→---
   125→
   126→## Design Principles (apply inline, no separate document)
   127→
   128→### Theme: Light, Minimal, BUT Distinctive
   129→
   130→Always light mode. Minimal does NOT mean generic.
   131→
   132→**Color:** Start with warm or cool off-white base (not pure white). Add ONE refined accent color that fits the app's domain — not generic blue (#007bff).
   133→
   134→**Typography:** FORBIDDEN: Inter, Roboto, Open Sans, Lato, Arial, Helvetica, system-ui.
   135→
   136→| App Character | Recommended Fonts |
   137→|--------------|-------------------|
   138→| Data/Analytics | Space Grotesk, IBM Plex Sans, Geist |
   139→| Fitness/Health | Outfit, Nunito Sans, DM Sans |
   140→| Finance | Source Serif 4, Newsreader, IBM Plex Serif |
   141→| Creative | Syne, Bricolage Grotesque, Cabinet Grotesk |
   142→| Professional | Source Sans 3, Plus Jakarta Sans, Manrope |
   143→
   144→Typography hierarchy through extreme weight differences (300 vs 700) and size jumps (24px vs 14px).
   145→
   146→**Colors must be oklch() functions:**
   147→```css
   148→--primary: oklch(0.52 0.22 264);   /* ✅ */
   149→--primary: 0.52 0.22 264;          /* ❌ breaks! */
   150→```
   151→
   152→### Layout: Visual Interest Required
   153→
   154→Every layout needs variation — size, weight, spacing, format, typography. If everything is the same size in identical cards, it's AI slop.
   155→
   156→**Mobile:** Vertical flow, thumb-friendly, hero dominates first viewport.
   157→**Desktop:** Use horizontal space, multi-column where appropriate, hover reveals.
   158→
   159→---
   160→
   161→## Critical Implementation Rules
   162→
   163→### Type Imports
   164→```typescript
   165→// ❌ WRONG
   166→import { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   167→// ✅ CORRECT
   168→import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   169→```
   170→
   171→### extractRecordId Null Check
   172→```typescript
   173→const id = extractRecordId(record.fields.relation);
   174→if (!id) return;
   175→```
   176→
   177→### Dates Without Seconds
   178→```typescript
   179→const dateForAPI = formData.date + 'T12:00'; // YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM only
   180→```
   181→
   182→### Select Never Empty Value
   183→```typescript
   184→// ❌ <SelectItem value="">None</SelectItem>
   185→// ✅ <SelectItem value="none">None</SelectItem>
   186→```
   187→
   188→---
   189→
   190→## Completeness Checklist
   191→
   192→### Theme
   193→- [ ] Font loaded via @import url() in index.css (FIRST, before tailwindcss!)
   194→- [ ] Font is NOT from forbidden list
   195→- [ ] All CSS variables are oklch() functions
   196→- [ ] Color palette fits the app's domain
   197→
   198→### Core Component
   199→- [ ] Interactive component implements the chosen UI paradigm
   200→- [ ] Users can create, edit, delete directly from the dashboard
   201→- [ ] Component takes significant screen space (hero element)
   202→
   203→### Technical
   204→- [ ] `npm run build` passes
   205→- [ ] All states handled: loading (Skeleton), empty, error
   206→- [ ] No hardcoded demo data
   207→- [ ] Responsive: mobile and desktop layouts
   208→
   209→---
   210→
   211→## Living Apps API Reference
   212→
   213→### Date Formats (STRICT!)
   214→
   215→| Field Type | Format | Example |
   216→|------------|--------|---------|
   217→| `date/date` | `YYYY-MM-DD` | `2025-11-06` |
   218→| `date/datetimeminute` | `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM` | `2025-11-06T12:00` |
   219→
   220→NO seconds for `datetimeminute`!
   221→
   222→### applookup Fields
   223→
   224→Store full URLs: `https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}`
   225→
   226→```typescript
   227→import { extractRecordId, createRecordUrl } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   228→import { APP_IDS } from '@/types/app';
   229→
   230→const recordId = extractRecordId(record.fields.category);
   231→if (!recordId) return;
   232→
   233→const data = { category: createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.CATEGORIES, selectedId) };
   234→```
   235→
   236→### API Response Format
   237→
   238→Returns **object**, NOT array. Use `Object.entries()` to extract `record_id`.
   239→
   240→---
   241→
   242→## Data Fetching Pattern
   243→
   244→```typescript
   245→import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
   246→import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   247→import { LivingAppsService } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   248→
   249→function Dashboard() {
   250→  const [data, setData] = useState<Workout[]>([]);
   251→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
   252→  const [error, setError] = useState<Error | null>(null);
   253→
   254→  useEffect(() => {
   255→    async function fetchData() {
   256→      try {
   257→        const result = await LivingAppsService.getWorkouts();
   258→        setData(result);
   259→      } catch (err) {
   260→        setError(err instanceof Error ? err : new Error('Unknown error'));
   261→      } finally {
   262→        setLoading(false);
   263→      }
   264→    }
   265→    fetchData();
   266→  }, []);
   267→
   268→  if (loading) return <LoadingState />;
   269→  if (error) return <ErrorState error={error} />;
   270→  if (data.length === 0) return <EmptyState />;
   271→
   272→  return <DashboardContent data={data} />;
   273→}
   274→```
   275→
   276→## Relationship Handling (applookup)
   277→
   278→```typescript
   279→import { extractRecordId } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   280→
   281→const exerciseMap = useMemo(() => {
   282→  const map = new Map<string, Exercise>();
   283→  exercises.forEach(ex => map.set(ex.record_id, ex));
   284→  return map;
   285→}, [exercises]);
   286→
   287→const enriched = useMemo(() => {
   288→  return workouts.map(w => {
   289→    const id = extractRecordId(w.fields.exercise);
   290→    return { ...w, exercise: id ? exerciseMap.get(id) : null };
   291→  });
   292→}, [workouts, exerciseMap]);
   293→```
   294→
   295→## Chart Pattern (recharts)
   296→
   297→```typescript
   298→import { LineChart, Line, XAxis, YAxis, Tooltip, ResponsiveContainer } from 'recharts';
   299→
   300→<ResponsiveContainer width="100%" height={300}>
   301→  <LineChart data={data}>
   302→    <XAxis dataKey="name" stroke="var(--muted-foreground)" />
   303→    <YAxis stroke="var(--muted-foreground)" />
   304→    <Tooltip contentStyle={{ backgroundColor: 'var(--background)', border: '1px solid var(--border)' }} />
   305→    <Line type="monotone" dataKey="value" stroke="var(--primary)" strokeWidth={2} dot={false} />
   306→  </LineChart>
   307→</ResponsiveContainer>
   308→```
   309→
   310→## Available Libraries
   311→
   312→- **shadcn/ui** — all components in `src/components/ui/`
   313→- **recharts** — LineChart, BarChart, PieChart, AreaChart
   314→- **lucide-react** — icons
   315→- **date-fns** — date formatting with `de` locale
   316→
   317→## Date Formatting
   318→
   319→```typescript
   320→import { format, parseISO, formatDistance } from 'date-fns';
   321→import { de } from 'date-fns/locale';
   322→
   323→format(parseISO(record.createdat), 'dd.MM.yyyy', { locale: de });
   324→formatDistance(parseISO(record.createdat), new Date(), { addSuffix: true, locale: de });
   325→```
   326→
   327→## Number Formatting
   328→
   329→```typescript
   330→function formatNumber(value: number | null | undefined): string {
   331→  if (value == null) return '-';
   332→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE').format(value);
   333→}
   334→
   335→function formatCurrency(value: number | null | undefined): string {
   336→  if (value == null) return '-';
   337→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE', { style: 'currency', currency: 'EUR' }).format(value);
   338→}
   339→```
   340→

content.text:
**Analysis:** This is a Fitness & Nutrition Tracker with workout logging, body measurements, nutrition tracking, and goal management — a multi-domain app best served by a **Today's Dashboard** paradigm: a "what happened / what I need to do today" hub combining today's workout log (hero, interactive), daily nutrition macros progress rings, and body weight trend chart. This is the most natural interaction because fitness users have a daily routine and need to quickly log workouts and meals without navigating away.

Now I'll read the existing `index.css` to understand the structure before editing.
Now let me check what shadcn components are available and what the existing component structure looks like.
